alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Grafton; Hillsborough; Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 11:29AM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central, northern, and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In northern New Hampshire, Grafton. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire and Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until 315 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. In additional rainfall rates may exceed 2 inches per around by this afternoon. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Claremont, Lebanon, Jaffrey, New London, Grafton, Hanover, Peterborough, Rindge, Enfield and Canaan.
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Turn around, don`t drown. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains.
